inkball

Class PlayerDrawnLine

  • java.lang.Object
    • inkball.PlayerDrawnLine

  • public class PlayerDrawnLine
extends java.lang.Object
    The PlayerDrawnLine class represents a line drawn by the player in the Inkball game. It manages the points that define the line, handles drawing the line on the game screen, and checks for collisions with balls.

      Draws the player-drawn line on the screen.

    • Method Detail

      • addPoint

        public void addPoint(float x,
                     float y)
        Adds a new point to the line.
        Parameters:
        x - The x-coordinate of the point.
        y - The y-coordinate of the point.

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Clears the points in the line, effectively removing it.

      • draw

        public void draw(App p)
        Draws the player-drawn line on the screen.
        Parameters:
        p - The App instance used to draw the line.

      • checkCollision

        public void checkCollision(Ball ball)
        Checks for collisions between the ball and the line. If a collision is detected, the ball's velocity is updated, and the line is cleared.
        Parameters:
        ball - The ball object to check for collision.

      • isNear

        public boolean isNear(float x,
                      float y)
        Checks if any part of the line is near a given point, used for detecting line deletion.
        Parameters:
        x - The x-coordinate of the point to check.
        y - The y-coordinate of the point to check.
        Returns:
        True if the line is near the point, otherwise false.
